these stunning **wheat stitch™ crochet trees** are ready to sleigh your holiday décor! ✨ worked in the round with my ***[signature wheat stitch™][1]*** from the very tip-top down, they grow with simple increases—no watering required.

with three different size options, you can stitch up a whole forest that’s merry, bright, and completely customizable. go traditional with evergreen shades, add a whimsical twist with candy-colored yarns, or create a frosty wonderland in snowy whites and silvers. try them in warm autumn shades for gorgeous thanksgiving décor, whip up a few spooky trees in black, purple, and orange for halloween, or even go pastel for springtime charm. with a quick color change, these trees can fit any season or celebration!

the wheat stitch texture adds a beautiful knit-like look that stands out in any setting, making these trees perfect for holiday decorating (mantels, shelves, and table centerpieces!), handmade gifting that brings joy to every home, and market prep for festive craft fairs. 

whether you’re crafting just one or an entire forest, the wheat stitch trees will bring handmade holiday cheer to your season.

[a video tutorial is included in the pattern.][2]

**crochet hook:** 
[h (5.0mm) - or size to meet gauge][3]

**notions:**
[removable stitch markers][4] 
[yarn needle to weave in ends][5] 
[scissors][6]
[paper mache cones][7]

**yarn:**
[brava tweed][8]
97% premium acrylic, 3% viscose 218yds/100g

**yarn quantities:**

50-205yds

**yarn substitutions:**
[brava worsted][9] - 100% premium acrylic, 218yds/100g

[herrschners worsted 8][10] - 100% acrylic, 489yds/226g

[herrschners worsted 3][11] - 100% acrylic, 183yds/85g

[red heart super saver flecks][12] - 96% acrylic/4% other fibers 236yds/141g

[malabrigo rios][13] - 100% superwash wool, 210yds/100g

**abbreviations:**
blo- back loop only
ch - chain
rs - right side
sc - single crochet
sl st - slip stitch
st(s) - stitch(es)
ws - wrong side

**gauge:**
not critical for this pattern.

not sure what gauge is? check out this blog post:  [what is crochet gauge and how to fix it][14]

**sizes:**
3 sizes - small, medium, large

**skill level:**
advanced beginner
